scope="col" | Pageant ! scope="col" | Wins |- | colspan="2" style="background:black" | |- | align="left" | Miss International | align="center" | 6 |- | align="left" | Miss Universe | align="center" | 4 |- | align="left" | Miss Supranational | align="center" | 1 |- | align="left" | Miss World | align="center" | 0 |- | align="left" | Miss Intercontinental | align="center" | 1 |- | align="left" | Miss Grand International | align="center" | 0 |- | align="left" | Miss Tourism Queen International | align="center" | 0 |- | align="left" | Miss Maja International | align="center" | 0 |- | align="left" | Miss Young International | align="center" | 0 |- | align="left" | Miss Globe | align="center" | 2 |- |} The following are the Binibining Pilipinas titleholders throughout the years, including the highlights of their performance in minor and Big Four international beauty pageants. ==Titles== Note that the year designates the time Binibining Pilipinas has acquired that particular pageant franchise. ;Current Big Four international beauty pageants: * Miss International (since 1968) Minor international beauty pageants: * Miss Intercontinental (since 2014) * Miss Grand International (since 2015) * Miss Globe (since 2015) ;Past * Miss Universe (1964–2019) * Miss World (1992–2010) * Miss Supranational (2012–2020) * Miss Tourism Queen International (2011–2015) * Miss Tourism (as a special title) (1987–1990; 1993–1994; 2005) * Miss Maja International (1972–1992; 1995) * Miss Young International (1970–1985) ==Titleholders== ;Color keys {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; line-height:17px; width:100%;" |- ! 1969 | 1st Runner-up Nelia Sancho | Queen of the Pacific | style="background:gold;" | Queen of the Pacific 1971 Nelia Sancho (Queen of the Pacific) | |- |} ;Notes # After the pageant in 2012, Binibining Pilipinas 2012 First Runner-up Elaine Moll was appointed the title of Binibining Pilipinas-Supranational and became that year's official representative to the Miss Supranational. Binibining Pilipinas 2012 second runner-up Annalie Forbes replaced her as the first runner-up. Annalie Forbes was then appointed and given the title of Miss Grand Philippines by the Miss Grand International organizers and John dela Vega to be the Philippines' first representative to the first Miss Grand International, where she placed third runner-up. ==References== ==External links== * Binibining Pilipinas Official website Titleholders * Category:Beauty pageants in the Philippines Category:Lists of women in beauty pageants
